title: Vicky Pattison reflects on her weight loss obsession as she embarks on fitness journey
text:
Vicky Pattison has discussed her battle with body image as she reflected on her yo-yoing weight, which has fluctuated between a size 16 and a size six.

The television personality, 31, took to Instagram on Thursday to share a throwback photo of herself at her slimmest alongside a snap of herself at a fitness retreat in Cyprus from last week.

In the candid post, Vicky revealed there was a time where was convinced she was 'fat', yet trained twice a day, counted the blueberries on her porridge and never ate at restaurants.

Health: Vicky Pattison has discussed her battle with body image as she reflected on her yo-yoing weight (pictured left as a size six)

Admitting she has gained some weight this year but was no longer the 'sad girl', Vicky told her fans she was determined to get back on track and 'fall in love' with fitness again.

In a lengthy post, the former Geordie Shore star candidly wrote: 'Same girl, very different person...It has taken me years to realise that health & fitness should not look like this picture on the left.

'I remember the day this was taken, I was hungry (to be fair I always am) & I was miserable, I was in the smallest women’s size available & was contemplating shopping in the children’s section. I thought I was fat.

'I’m not 110% happy with how I look': Vicky vowed over the next few months she was embarking on an exciting journey of self discovery and 'fall in love with fitness again' (pictured last month)

Change: The former Geordie Shore beauty, 31, revealed that she intends to kick-start her lifestyle after feeling uncomfortable and living in fear of someone 'taking a picture' of her

'Can you believe that? I was sad because I thought I looked fat. I was sad because I counted how many blueberries I put on my porridge every morning (like some kind of crazed calorie obsessed Carol Vorderman), I didn’t drink, I never ate in restaurants & I trained twice a day.

'Now look at the girl on the right- yip, I’ve gained some weight this year.. I’m not 110% happy with how I look.

'But I’ve been busy & I’m not going to be so hard on myself. But she is happy, she is strong, she is in a healthy & loving relationship & she lives a full & exciting life filled with travel, adventure, carbs & aperol spritz!

Hard: Vicky continued: 'I was sad because I thought I looked fat. I was sad because I counted how many blueberries I put on my porridge every morning' (pictured last year)

'I will never go back to that sad girl on the left- it wasn’t the life for me.'

Vicky vowed over the next few months she was embarking on an exciting journey of self discovery and 'fall in love with fitness again'.

She said while she would like to lose a couple of dress sizes, her mission instead was for her mental health and to feel 'strong and sassy'.

The former I'm A Celebrity jungle queen was praised by a slew of reality stars for her frank and honest admission.

Gabby Allen wrote: 'you're amazing'. Fellow Love Island alum said:'Unreal work this Vicky'.

Jess Wright added: 'Amen'.

Back in May, Vicky was diagnosed with condition called nocturnal sleep-related eating disorder (NS-RED) - which sees her eat in the middle of the night with no recollection of doing so.

The condition is defined by sleepeducation.org as a parasomnia consisting of repeated episodes of compulsive binge eating and drinking after waking up in the night, which occur when you are only partially awake.
